alert.note: Alert for Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 12:00PM PDT until April 11 at 10:09PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Malheur River Near Vale affecting Malheur County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Malheur River Near Vale. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, The river will begin spilling over its bank flooding farmland between Vale and Ontario. Water will begin approaching low spots on Butte Drive. Water will approach the 36th Street Bridge upstream from Ontario about 8 hours after flood stage is exceeded near Vale. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Tuesday /11:30 AM PDT Tuesday/ the stage was 19.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM MDT Tuesday /11:30 AM PDT Tuesday/ was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 12.4 feet Friday, April 21. - Flood stage is 19.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 02/08/1951. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM MDT /1015 PM PDT/.
